summary:
Dystopias are imaginary societies that are scary and terrible places to live. They are the opposite of utopias, which are perfect societies. In dystopian stories, governments are often cruel and control people using propaganda and force. People might not be able to think freely or be themselves. 

Famous books like *Nineteen Eighty-Four* and *Fahrenheit 451* show dystopian worlds. These stories can teach us about real-world problems and warn us about what could happen if things go wrong.
title: Dystopia
